Dialogue.Page: Oh no.. This is bad.. Real bad..

DialogueOption.Text: Hello?
Hey. I think you dropped this.

Dialogue.Page: This is bad.. Real bad..
Did you find the scroll?

DialogueOption.Text: Yes. Here it is.
No, not yet.
No, I need a password to access it.
What am I looking for again?

Dialogue.Page: This is bad.. Real bad..
Did you find the scroll?

DialogueOption.Text: Yes. Here it is.
No, not yet.
What am I looking for again?
Can you remind me the password clues?

Dialogue.Page: Oh hi! My name is Callis. I don't think I've met you before?

DialogueOption.Text: What's wrong? You seemed to be worried about something

Dialogue.Page: Oh, well.. Erm.. this is a bit embarassing
You see, this is a big day for me. This is my first contribution to a festival and I'm about to present my thesis to the other Nomai.

DialogueOption.Text: Isn't this a good thing?

Dialogue.Page: Well yes but I.. may have lost my thesis scroll?
I can't present my thesis without it. I'm going to look like such a fool in front of the others, this is so bad!

DialogueOption.Text: Maybe I could help?
Oh. Well that's sure to be entertaining. See you then!

Dialogue.Page: I've looked everywhere, so I don't think you could..
Wait..
That's it! I remember I had it saved in the archives (in case such event happened)
If I had the copy there I could present my thesis
Would you be so kind as to get it for me please?

DialogueOption.Text: Sounds like a plan.
Not to be rude, but can't you get it yourself?

Dialogue.Page: I'm afraid I have to stay here. I still have things to prepare and people would notice if I was gone.

DialogueOption.Text: Fair enough. What is the scroll you need then?

Dialogue.Page: Thank you, you're a lifesaver! I believe it should be archived under my name, "Callis #001 - Thesis"
The archive building is on the North pole, if you've never been there.

DialogueOption.Text: I'll be back with it.

Dialogue.Page: My thesis scroll in the archives. I believe it should be under my name, "Callis #001 - Thesis"
The archive building is on the North pole, if you've never been there.

DialogueOption.Text: I'll be back with it.

Dialogue.Page: Oh, yes. I forgot about that.
I did set up a password so that the first witnesses of my work would be at my presentation.
I would have removed the password after the ceremony, I swear!

DialogueOption.Text: What's the password then? We sort of need it now, before the ceremony.

Dialogue.Page: Yes of course. Let me think. The password was..
It was..

DialogueOption.Text: Did you forget your password as well?

Dialogue.Page: No!
Maybe a bit. But I do have my note as to remember it, look!
"Hey me! You probably forgot your password again so I'm writing this secret code to retrieve it!".
"First part of the password is the age you were when your parents took you to your first festival".
"Second part of the password is the archive building broadcast signal (assuming it has not changed since I set up the password)
"Third part of the password is the number of legs of the red-bellied horned bukrad".

DialogueOption.Text: I did not understand one bit of this

Dialogue.Page: Well I made it complicated so that the password would be secure.
For the first part, it's 10. I will always remember the day of my first festival. I met so many people and learned so many amazing things!

DialogueOption.Text: And the rest?

Dialogue.Page: Well..

DialogueOption.Text: You forgot?

Dialogue.Page: I forgot.

DialogueOption.Text: I figured.

Dialogue.Page: Good luck?

DialogueOption.Text: Thanks, I guess.
You know what, I'm going to go explore another planet first.

Dialogue.Page: Sure, here it is:
"Hey me! You probably forgot your password again so I'm writing this secret code to retrieve it!".
"First part of the password is the age you were when your parents took you to your first festival - so that's 10".
"Second part of the password is the archive building broadcast signal (assuming it has not changed since I set up the password)
"Third part of the password is the number of legs of the red-bellied horned bukrad".

DialogueOption.Text: 10, broadcast signal, legs of bukrad, TODO. Got it.

Dialogue.Page: Please be quick..
Thank you so much friend!
You saved my life today!
Wait, is that..
I hope it was not too hard to get.

DialogueOption.Text: It's okay, I learned a lot of things.
I never want to hear about bukrads ever again

Dialogue.Page: Oh. I'm sorry to hear..
Well, in any case
